title: Painting Damaged by Beirut Explosion Is a Long-Lost Gentileschi
description: A painting that was scarred by the 2020 blast in Beirut is now attributed to Artemisia Gentileschi, the great 17th-century Italian painter known for her depiction of strong women.
dc:creator: Jori Finkel
media:credit: Brian Guido for The New York Times
media:description: “Hercules and Omphale,” by Artemisia Gentileschi, is being repaired at the Getty Museum’s conservation studio in Los Angeles. It had hung in the Sursock Palace in Beirut as an anonymous 17th-century painting.
